facts.fact_text: Copper fell to around $5.77 per pound on Friday, hitting its lowest level in nearly six weeks.

evidences.evidence_text: Copper fell to around $5.77 per pound on Friday, hitting its lowest level in nearly six weeks

facts.fact_text: Copper is on track for its worst week since late November.

evidences.evidence_text: and on track for its worst week since late November

facts.fact_text: Stockpiles in LME warehouses across Asia are climbing.

evidences.evidence_text: Stockpiles in LME warehouses across Asia are also climbing

facts.fact_text: The China Nonferrous Metals Industry Association projected that refined copper output will rise about 5% in 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: Market sentiment was further weighed down after the China Nonferrous Metals Industry Association projected that refined copper output will rise about 5% in 2026, half the growth recorded in 2025.

claims.claim_text: Slowing demand from Chinese buyers and rising inventories pressured copper prices.

evidences.evidence_text: pressured by slowing demand from Chinese buyers and rising inventories

claims.claim_text: The trend of rising stockpiles could accelerate as traders divert shipments from Africa to China to take advantage of temporary price gaps between Shanghai and London.

evidences.evidence_text: Analysts say the trend could accelerate as traders divert shipments from Africa to China to take advantage of temporary price gaps between Shanghai and London.

evidence.evidence_text: pressured by slowing demand from Chinese buyers
pressured by slowing demand from Chinese buyers and rising inventories
